pros: Nice work life balance, good support from your manager

Amazing supportive staff and managers. I came here will little experience and over the last year and a half I have learnt so much and feel confident and proud of my job. The mangers are very passionate about progression not only for the students but for their staff too and want the best for them. I am current in the process of applying for a new position within the college.
cons: Only con would be the pay isn’t amazing but it’s certainly better than a lot of schools in the area!

job_title: Functional Skills Lecturer in Gloucester, England
pros: A company that really does care about their staff. Good Pay, bonus and yearly pay rise. Pension, healthcare scheme and much more. A well balanced, calm place to work where my boss listens and I have really nice colleagues to work with, overall have a positive outlook. I love my job as I get full autonomy over how I teach my students and how I support those with neuro diversities. It'a fast paced environment, but I never feel overworked, stressed or taken for granted. There is always room to progress and there are plenty of courses to broaden your horizons if you can work it around your job.
cons: Some long term staff are hard to persuade to new ways of working and thinking. Not all my wisdom is taken on board and used to improve the business.
Very low pay and pay rise under inflation

pros: Good team spirit at the chalkface

review_title: Strong support for staff and loads of benefits
pros: Good pay Strong support for staff Excellent line manager
cons: working late nights planning for learning

review_title: One of the best places I've worked in a long time.
pros:
It's nice to work for an organization that actually cares about its employees.
Finish 30 minutes early on a Friday.
Closed for a week or two over Christmas (and it's paid and not taken out your annual leave).
Everyone is friendly and supportive.
During my time there, my team received several small pay raises as a result of inflation.
cons: Not always an obvious career progression.

pros: Great students and facilities. Buildings are well maintained and resourced. There is a much more progressive attitude from management than their used to be. Some allowance for flexible working where it can be accommodated.
cons: Salaries are low and hours are long.
